newsitem.title: USA: Widespread aflatoxin found in south Texas corn.
newsitem.headline: Widespread aflatoxin found in south Texas corn.

text.p: Aflatoxin, a potent carcinogen, has been discovered in much of the corn harvested along the Texas Gulf Coast, and Texas grain sources said more may be found as the harvest moves north.

"It is a high level (of contamination) and it is serious," said George Latimer, the Texas state chemist based in College Station, Tx. "The levels of aflatoxin are of considerable concern throughout Texas."
